head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Russia: Blast Injures Regional Leader

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Russia: Blast Injures Regional Leader

body.head.byline:
By Steven Lee Myers (NYT)
Two explosions in quick succession struck the motorcade of a senior official in Ingushetia, a restive region bordering Chechnya, killing a bodyguard and wounding three others, the deputy chief doctor at the central hospital in the region's capital, Nazran, said in a telephone interview. Ibrahim Malsagov, chairman of Ingushetia's regional government, suffered shrapnel wounds in the head, legs and back in what officials called an assassination attempt. It was the latest in a series of bombings that have roiled southern Russia. On Monday, an explosion killed one and injured two near the hospital in Nazran. Steven Lee Myers (NYT)
